summary: The "human development index" is a concept that has been redirected to the preferred term "human development" within the context of EU economic policy. This index serves as a composite measure assessing the socio-economic progress of nations, incorporating factors such as life expectancy, education, and per capita income. In EU legal and regulatory frameworks, human development is pivotal for shaping policies aimed at enhancing the quality of life and ensuring equitable growth across member states. By prioritizing human development, the EU aims to foster sustainable economic growth while addressing social disparities, thereby aligning with its broader objectives of promoting social cohesion and well-being.
